meanings.definition: To back out of a commitment or agreement.
meanings.sent1: She always crawfishes when it's time to help with chores.
meanings.sent2: He crawfishes out of his promise to join the club.
meanings.sent3: The cat crawfishes away from getting a bath.
meanings.sent4: His excuses to crawfish out of work were getting old.
meanings.sent5: The student tried to crawfish out of presenting in front of the class.

meanings.definition: A small freshwater crustacean resembling a lobster.
meanings.sent1: The kids caught crawfishes by the creek.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served delicious crawfishes with butter.
meanings.sent3: The crawfishes had a party in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The crawfishes scuttled along the riverbed like tiny lobsters.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman's bucket was full of lively crawfishes.
